file_content.text: Officer Keeling took care of my broker's fee. Pleasure doing business with you.
Poor slicers are in over their heads.
Pleasure, my lord. I've heard all about you. Especially the business with Agent Dellocon.
Honored, my lord. This moon's buzzing with your presence. Business with Lord Paladius, if I'm not mistaken.
Agent. I had to dig deep to hear about you. Secret business with Watcher X, right? Don't worry, I won't tell.
I know you, hunter. Participant in the Great Hunt, dealings with Eidolon. Right? Of course I am.
You're making quite the impression on this moon. I know. I've seen the details.
Call me Ghost. Nar Shaddaa's premiere information broker. Intel's my business, and business is booming.
If you have information concerning the Empire, I'd suggest you surrender it.
Tell me what you know.
My reports are pricey. But for an esteemable Sith Lord, this one's free.
Search my history, and you may damage your sanity.
You'd be wise not to pry.
I wouldn't dream of infringing on your privacy, my lord.
Business would be even better if you dealt exclusively with the Empire.
Intelligence could use you.
I'm flattered, but I prefer neutrality. Still, the Empire holds a special place in my heart.
Stay out of my business, and we won't have a problem.
Don't dig too deep.
I'm happy to extend a fellow freelancer that courtesy.
Intel broker? Seems illegal.
My methods are my own, and they produce results.
What a blowhard.
What can I say? I'm the best information broker on this moon.
In fact, I have intel that may pique your interest. Usually I charge top credit, but for you, this one's free.
Spare me the sales pitch.
Of course. Let's talk business.
My scanners picked up recent additions to Nar Shaddaa's information market. Top secret Imperial Intelligence reports. About to be sold to the highest bidder.
Nar Shaddaa will mock the Empire if our secrets get out. The sale must be stopped.
This weakens the Empire.
Agreed, my lord. You'll be pleased to know the culprits aren't far.
Intelligence won't stand for this.
Unacceptable.
There's still time to unleash Intelligence's fury.
I bet the Imps will pay a fortune to get those reports back.
Sounds like opportunity.
I imagine you're right.
Who is the seller?
The culprits covered their tracks well, but I cracked their encryption. Looks like a slicer gang's to blame.
Are you lying to me, Ghost?
The intel's solid. I stake my reputation on it.
I've traced the Intelligence reports to slicers in a gang called the Krayts. Not the friendliest bunch to grace Nar Shaddaa, but they've pulled some amazing jobs.
The sale's almost final; however, there's still time to find those Krayt slicers and recover the Empire's precious secrets.
Thanks for the tip.
They tend to hang out in the marketplace. It's not far.
What's your angle, Ghost?
You got me. I receive a small broker's fee once you recover the reports. Part of a deal I have with the Empire.
Once you find the reports, hand them over to Intelligence Officer Keeling. I'm sure he'll be delighted to see you.
I don't buy it. [Refuse quest]
If you insist. Tell your friends about me. Ghost is always looking for new clients.
You have the credits? I have the answers.
